Update order of Gem::Dependency requirements to match rubygems

The version of rubygems distributed with ruby 2.6.3 performs an internal sort on
the requirements list before returning it via `requirements_list`, which the
`Dependency` class uses here when we haven't already set it.

Merge pull request #2078 from sonalkr132/mfa-rate-limit

Add exponential backoff rate limit to endpoints using mfa

Use recognize_path instead of regex in throttling

regex matching was prone to errors/loopholes.

Add exponential backoff rate limit to endpoints using mfa

Exponential backoff was needed as with 100 req/10 min limit used in
other endpoints would have been inefficient against brute force of
mfa code.
30 sec window would have had probability of 1/10000 (1 - (1 - p)^n, where p = 10^-6 and n = 100)
for successfully guessing the key *at least once* if limits were 100 req/10 min.
Using binomial distribution, a HO reporter calculcated that after
6932 trials, he would have had more than 50% chance of successfully
guessing the key at least once.
Limits used in this change would allow 4 trails per week and total
of 33 years for 6932 trials.

Use Sendgrid Webhook to track failed emails per user

- Intended to be used for future features that should only send
  emails to receptive inboxes.
- Tracks number of failed deliveries since last successful delivery in
  column `users.mail_fails`.
- Only counts max of 1 email failure per day to allow for inbox downtime
- Resets `users.mail_fails` to 0 when user changes email
- Sendgrid webhook endpoint is protected by HTTP Basic Auth

Merge pull request #1950 from eliotsykes/gem-pushed-mail

Send email to gem owners on push

Send email to gem owners on push

Email gem owners each time a new version is pushed. The intention is
to help owners detect compromised gems sooner.

Users have the option to toggle their personal notification settings
for each gem they own. When these notification settings are changed,
the user will be alerted by email in case their account has been
compromised and the attacker is disabling gem-push notifications before
they push a new version.

Both the gem-pushed email and notifications-changed email contain
brief guidance on what to do should the recipient think their account
has been compromised.

module tree but is still active! (ArgumentError) in development.rb

initialization.

Merge pull request #1933 from sonalkr132/slow-just-updated

Use limit in subquery for new pushed versions

Use limit in subquery for new pushed versions

The subquery without limit meant the query as whole has to spend lot
of time in filtering (~110k more). Updated method is 3.45 times faster.
[Benchmarks and query
analyze](https://gist.github.com/sonalkr132/2070908d1d036e9916ca1002fa13b6c0)

Verified with following that output didn't change:
```
versions = Version.new_pushed_versions(10000).pluck(:id)
new_versions = Version.newer_pushed_versions(10000).pluck(:id)

versions.each_with_index do |v_id, idx|
  puts "#{idx}, #{v_id} - #{new_versions[idx]}" if v_id != new_versions[idx]
end
```

Eager loading gem_downloads removes one n + 1 for downloads per gem.

Enable rails 5.2 defaults

use_authenticated_cookie_encryption doesn't affect as we don't use
encrypted cookies. We use secure random (20 bytes) in remember_token
plaintext cookie.
use_authenticated_message_encryption doesn't affect as we don't use
encrypted messages.

form_with_generates_ids and represent_boolean_as_integer doesn't affect
as we don't use `form_with` or sqlite.

use_sha1_digests was introduced for FIPS compliance (doesn't allow md5).
This will invalidate Etags (used in compact index).

Enable json cookie serializer

We have used hybrid (legacy support for marshaled token) for over 4
years
https://github.com/rubygems/rubygems.org/blame/15c30013dc48b9c0789a7c695cc19a538b761b32/config/initializers/cookies_serializer.rb.
We can safely disable marshal support now ([Read
why](https://blog.bigbinary.com/2014/12/23/migrating-existing-session-cookies-while-upgrading-to-rails-4-1-and-above.html)).

rails 5 app:update already tries to change it to :json
https://github.com/rubygems/rubygems.org/commit/79d67c8d08e75a76c9e926aeac5b0062153fc0e1#diff-5a36378a78c8873c0e156d326347a1fcR5

skip was added to Api::V1::VersionsController:latest to fix following
error. previously we had whitelisted action names so this was not being
raised:
ActionController::InvalidCrossOriginRequest: Security warning: an
embedded <script> tag on another site requested protected JavaScript. If
you know what you're doing, go ahead and disable forgery protection on this action to permit
cross-origin JavaScript embedding.

skip was removed from Api::V1::SearchesController as it only has GET
methods.

set_locale is moved for aesthetic.

rescue_from was added for ActionController::InvalidAuthenticityToken,
as this is expected client side error (not 500).

Enable rails 5.1 default configs

`form_with_generates_remote_forms` changing to `true` doesn't affect
as we don't use `form_with`.

`unknown_asset_fallback` is set to `true` by sprockets-rails as a
deprecation step. We don't see any deprecation as we don't have any
asset fallback to public folder.

Enable rails 5.0 defaults

`forgery_protection_origin_check = true` would check if `Origin` HTTP
header is set to `rubygems.org`. While web browsers have good support
for it, our CLI doesn't set this header and potentially other users
of our API would not be sending it. Unless we can skip this test for
update methods of API (like `skip_before_action :verify_authenticity_token`)
we can't enable it.

Set belongs_to_required_by_default to true

Optional associations should use `optional: true` and rest should
raise validation error by default.

Dependency belongs_to rubygems is optional when dendency name used
in gemspec couldn't be resolved to any existing gem.
GemDownload belongs_to versions is optional when tracking total
gem downloads (version_id: 0). GemDownload belongs_to rubygems is
optional when tracking total downloads of all gems (rubygem_id: 0).
WebHook belongs_to rubygem is option for global web hooks.

Linkset factory was missing `rubygem` (required) association. Rubygem
factory needs to create linkset in callback or else it will be circular
depdendency. AFAIK, factory bot doesn't support
`build(:rubygem, linkset: build(:linkset, docs:
"http://example.com/doc"))`. Additionally, we have tests which assume
presence of `linkset` on `rubygem` factory. `if.. else` is used to
support these two cases.

Merge pull request #1935 from pt-stripe/patch-1

Remove broken reference to `Download`

Remove broken reference to `Download`

As part of open sourcing our Ruby typechecker, Sorbet (https://sorbet.run/) we're using it to check large open source Ruby projects. When I ran it on your project, it reported the error:

```
./test/unit/rubygem_test.rb:799: Unable to resolve constant Download http://go/e/5002
     799 |        1.times { Download.incr(@rubygem.name, @version.full_name) }
                            ^^^^^^^^
    ./app/models/gem_download.rb:1: Did you mean: GemDownload?
     1 |class GemDownload < ApplicationRecord
        ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
```

It looks like this constant indeed doesn't exist in your codebase (that I can tell, please correct me if I'm wrong). This specific code will never run because there are no `should` blocks in it so I think that is why it wasn't caught by your runtime testing.

Merge pull request #1916 from sonalkr132/lower-full-name-idx

Add lower index to versions full name

Add lower index to versions full name

`validates :full_name, presence: true, uniqueness: { case_sensitive:
false }` creates sql:
```
SELECT  1 AS one FROM "versions" WHERE LOWER("versions"."full_name") =
LOWER($1) AND "versions"."id" != $2 LIMIT $3
```
it was not hitting index because of `lower` expression:
```
gemcutter_development=# explain analyse SELECT  1 AS one FROM "versions"
WHERE LOWER("versions"."full_name") = LOWER('nokogiri-1.8.3') AND
"versions"."id" != 1062467 LIMIT 1;
                                                    QUERY PLAN
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 Limit  (cost=0.00..13.29 rows=1 width=0) (actual time=681.907..681.907
rows=0 loops=1)
   ->  Seq Scan on versions  (cost=0.00..68408.23 rows=5148 width=0)
(actual time=681.906..681.906 rows=0 loops=1)
         Filter: ((id <> 1062467) AND (lower((full_name)::text) =
'nokogiri-1.8.3'::text))
         Rows Removed by Filter: 1029670
 Planning time: 1.250 ms
 Execution time: 681.960 ms
(6 rows)

gemcutter_development=# create index on "versions" (lower("full_name"));
CREATE INDEX
gemcutter_development=# explain analyse SELECT  1 AS one FROM "versions"
WHERE LOWER("versions"."full_name") = LOWER('nokogiri-1.8.3') AND
"versions"."id" != 1062467 LIMIT 1;
                                                                QUERY
PLAN
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 Limit  (cost=0.42..4.27 rows=1 width=0) (actual time=0.092..0.092
rows=0 loops=1)
   ->  Index Scan using versions_lower_idx on versions
(cost=0.42..19795.38 rows=5148 width=0) (actual time=0.091..0.091 rows=0
loops=1)
         Index Cond: (lower((full_name)::text) = 'nokogiri-1.8.3'::text)
         Filter: (id <> 1062467)
         Rows Removed by Filter: 1
 Planning time: 0.488 ms
 Execution time: 0.137 ms
(7 rows)
```

purge multiple domains
purge multiple domains

fix typo in path

Fix a typo from #1907

Reorder versions only when indexed column changes

Periously, versions were getting reordered for any change to version
record and causing performance issue where gems have a large set of
released versions.
We need to reorder versions only when a new version is created or when
a version is yanked (indexed column changes).
This reduces versions reordering in gem push from thrice to once and
in gem yank from twice to once.

stop checking database during healthcheck

Extract dynamic_form's error_messages_for to avoid a wrong i18n scope

Closes #1834

The problem occurs because we use `form.error_messages` in the form and
dynamic_form adds `activerecord.errors.template.{header/body}` i18n key
when it has error. The problem is that `rails-i18n` gem doesn't have
this key. It has `errors.template.{header.body}` instead. To fix this,
we did extract the method to our helper and removed this wrong scope.

We also have removed the dynamic_form dependency with this change.

Use build option instead of method override in test gem helper

The `Gem::Package.build` method takes an argument which allows the validation
step to be skipped, but it was not in use here. This helper skips the validation
to suppress noisy output about a (fake) gemspec defined in the test helper. We
were previously suppressing the output via a method override, this change
updates to use an option instead.

Remove pagination page links from reverse deps

COUNT(DISTINCT ..) used in pagination for page number links is very expensive
in this case. This change will only show `next` and `prev` page link.

change of includes to preload:
kaminari overrides load method to load one extra record, which is used
to check if there is a need for next page. `includes` was returning
only per_page (30) entries instead of expected per_page + 1.
In hindsight, preload also takes load off main query which finds all
dependant gems and should have been used from start.

response time of /gems/rails/reverse_dependencies (tested locally)
before: 0m1.564s
after: 0m0.708s

Replace will_paginate with kaminari

We need option to avoid COUNT(DISTINCT ..) used to calculate
total_entries or total pages.
will_paginate doesn't support it.

Merge pull request #1785 from mjankowski/rack-attack-test-speedup

Simplify and speed up rack-attack integration tests

Update shoulda to version 3.6.0

This change updates shoulda-matchers to version 3.1.2, and shoulda-context to
version 1.2.2.

Changes for matchers - https://github.com/thoughtbot/shoulda-matchers/blob/master/NEWS.md#312

After version 3.0 matchers no longer need `require: false` in the Gemfile, and
can just be included like a regular gem. As a side effect of that change, the
library needs an explicit config block which loads only the portions relevant to
a particular test suite (in our case, minitest and rails).

There were two tests which were erroneously checking for a `flash.now` value,
when their controllers actually just set the `flash`. This was passing on prior
shoulda versions, but now (correctly) fails, so the test was changed to match
the code.

Simplify and speed up rack-attack integration tests

Instead of running hundreds of requests here, we can put the cache in a
condition where rack-attack will believe that the requests have happened and
then block the subsequent request made in the test.

This should reduce intermittent failures, and also speed up the test.

The setup block populates the cache for a particular IP address to simulate too
many requests, and each test supplies that IP address in the request that is
made, which ensures that the pre-populated cache is the one which is checked.
This mirrors real world behavior of the rack-attack prevention mechanism.

however we use DNS to route test requests to specific POPs such as
`iad.pops.fastly-insights.com`, therefore the policy needs to be a
wildcard *.fastly-insights.com. It then fetches small image objects to
different nearby POPS to get timing information and one fetch request
to get the resolver information.

Merge pull request #1723 from sonalkr132/race-create

Persist records before uploading to s3

Test parallel push doesn't lead mismatched sha

transactional_test is set to false because general test flow doesn't
clear records created in Thread.new which use different db connection.

Persist records before uploading to s3

When same gem version is pushed in parallel, upload to s3 is run for
both the process. Process which commits trancation in
Rubygems#update_attributes_from_gem_specification! first gets to set
version.sha256, while process which uploads to s3 last gets to write
gem file. These two processes need not be same and hence lead of sha
mismatch.
If we persist version record before uploading to s3, other processes
will get record not unique violation and not overwrite gem file in s3.

Update Support Section

Reason for Change
=================
* As a result of some confusion about how RubyGems.org is supported, the folks at [Ruby Together](rubytogether.org) and @evanphx worked on some language we can use broadly to help clarify things.

Changes
=======
* Add the same paragraph from [our RT discussion](https://github.com/rubytogether/board/issues/5) here in this `README.md`.

Minor
-----
* Rename `Supporting` section heading to `Support` to move from a "how you could support this project" to "how it's currently being supported". Interested in feedback on this angle.
* Add the Ruby Central logo.

Associations should be defined before of being used in `:through`

In Active Record 5.1+ isn't possible to use an association in `:through`
option before of defining it, e.g:

```
has_many :rubygems, through: :ownerships
has_many :ownerships, dependent: :destroy
```

will raise an error because the `ownerships` association is being used
in the first association before of being defined, to fix it the order of
the associations needs to be changed:

```
has_many :ownerships, dependent: :destroy
has_many :rubygems, through: :ownerships
```

Add graphql-pro to blacklist (like sidekiq-pro)

Hi,

Thanks for your work on Rubygems.org! I've been trying to find a good solution for preventing naming conflicts with privately-distributed gems, and I'd like to take a page out of `sidekiq-pro`'s book, does this look OK?

I distribute a gem called `graphql-pro` from a private server, but I want to prevent naming conflicts for a few reasons:

- A malicious coder could put destructive code on Rubygems.org with the same name and attack users who forget the proper `source` in their Gemfile 
- I tried putting a dummy gem on Rubygems.org to prevent the naming ambiguity, but the problem is that `source` is not supported in `.gemspec` files. Some `graphql-pro` users want to add `graphql-pro` to internal gems, but it results in "Gem found in multiple sources" issues. So, blocking the namespace will support its use in `.gemspec` files. 

I see that `sidekiq-pro` was recently added without comment (7b363e19fbe901c59dc3ecc4e98a5a7a066795ee) so I hope this addition is OK too. I already control the (empty) graphql-pro gem, so reserving this namespace is no problem in that regard. 

Thanks again, and let me know if I can do something to improve this change!

Expire session after 2 weeks

Clearance expires remember_token only when a user logs out.

I’d be curious if anyone has a way around that would allow me to

New releases from all and popular gems

Ever wondered what new versions of gems were released lately? Or
new versions of popular gems?

This is what I’d like to provide with /news and /news/popular

Two simple endpoints to find a list of gems ordered by version release.

![][news-all]
![][news-popular]

I took the liberty to add a navigation item for these new routes since that sort of makes sense but I’m willing to part with it if nobody thinks it makes sense.

I haven’t taken the time to add any specs since I just wanted to prototype it and see if it made sense. So far I like it, and it’s very low impact so maintenance shouldn’t be too hard, but I’m sure I’m forgetting something.

Update rubocop from 0.47.1 to 0.48.1

Update rubocop from 0.47.1 to 0.48.1

fixes:
* Style/PercentLiteralDelimiters: %w-literals should be delimited by [ and ]. (https://github.com/bbatsov/ruby-style-guide#percent-literal-braces)
* Style/SymbolArray: Use %i or %I for an array of symbols. (https://github.com/bbatsov/ruby-style-guide#percent-i)
* Rails/Present: Use if platform.present? instead of unless platform.blank?
* Style/IndentHeredoc: Use 2 spaces for indentation in a heredoc by using <<~ instead of <<-. (https://github.com/bbatsov/ruby-style-guide#squiggly-heredocs)
* Lint/AmbiguousBlockAssociation: Parenthesize the param execute_raw_sql(query).map { |v| [v['name'], [v]] } to make sure that the block will be associated with the execute_raw_sql(query).map method call. (https://github.com/bbatsov/ruby-style-guide#syntax)
* Style/InverseMethods: Use none? instead of inverting any?.
* Rails/Blank: Use if suggestions.blank? instead of unless suggestions.present?

over `from`.

Merge pull request #1616 from sonalkr132/pre-rails-update-changed

Pre rails update changes

Change the default test queue_adapter to :test

Rails 5 uses async queue_adapter which uses a different thread to
work off jobs. We can't let that happen in our integration test because
we are relying on the mail being delievered and doing that in
a different thread leads to unpredictable delay.
Using `:test` facilitites use of `perform_enqueued_jobs` when needed.

Use request env, remove use of `to:` from route and fix content_type assertion

* env is deprecated and will be removed from Rails 5.1
  Use of request.env mentioned at: rails/rails@05934d2
* `to:` has regression rails 5 (fixed on 5.1)
* `response.content_type` won't respond to `symbol` in rails 5

Rake task to recalculate info_checksum of versions

compact_index updated to 0.11.0 was deployed on 2016-08-30 05:16:23.
It changed the info response from:
```
0.9.0 |checksum:fb240b8eccd251c4aa1d7e247c086a2bea7110fc72dd88f28ae2674820e4b56d,ruby:>= 0,rubygems:>= 0
```
to:
```
0.9.0 |checksum:fb240b8eccd251c4aa1d7e247c086a2bea7110fc72dd88f28ae2674820e4b56d
```
It left us with incorrect info_checksum for gems which hasn't released
or yanked any version since 2016-08-30 05:16:23.
The rake task will pick first version determined by `ORDER` and update
its info_checksum or yanked_info_checksum (it could be possible that
the version picked was yanked).
`ORDER BY rubygem_id, COALESCE(yanked_at, created_at) DESC, number DESC, platform DESC`
ensures that `versions.last` picked in `compact_index_public_versions`
is same as one picked in the rake task for update.

Auto merge of #1540 - sonalkr132:es_downloads, r=segiddins

Order downloads by rubygem_id before updating ES index

[`where(rubygem_id: gem_ids, version_id: 0)`](https://github.com/rubygems/rubygems.org/blob/master/app/models/gem_download.rb#L101) does not guarantee that order of returned records will be same that of gem_ids. [Zipping it with `updates_by_gem`](https://github.com/rubygems/rubygems.org/blob/master/app/models/gem_download.rb#L102) mixes up initial downloads and updates.

Related:  #1309
Failing build without this patch: [travis](https://travis-ci.org/sonalkr132/rubygems.org/jobs/191236193#L1129)

Auto merge of #1234 - kbrock:versioned_links, r=indirect

Leverage metadata to populate gems urls v2

## High Level Goals
1. The app knows too much about the url generation process. Provide a decorator `versioned_links` to simplify this logic.
2. More importantly: All metadata for a gem comes from the `gemspec` file except for urls. Provide a mechanism to put urls into the `gemspec`.

goal 1 makes the process of fetching the urls out of gemspec trivial - 2 lines of change. If we are unsure about #2, then can we at least focus/agree on the first goal?
## Commentary

This is an alternative to #724. It is in response to comment from @qrush [[here]](https://github.com/rubygems/rubygems.org/issues/1127#issuecomment-160361797) For implementing #1127 - take urls from `rubygems.metadata` and retire `linkset`.

@arthurnn ~~I thought it would be simpler to keep this separate from #724. Let me know if you want me to add metadata (and/or add change log) support directly to this PR.~~ I added in the metadata as the second commit
## before:

Links on the pages are generated from `Links` and `Version` objects. This is needed because some urls have `version.number`.
This logic finds it's way into rss, views, helpers, and models. Mostly in `rubygems.rb`, `rubygems_helper.rb`, and `links.rb`.
## after:

A decorator `LinkedVersion` is introduced to simplify the relationship between these objects. Since rss uses this as well, the decorator is kept in `app/model/`.
## future:

Once `rubygems.metadata` is used by most (all?) gems, drop linkset. (many years from now)

Thanks,
Keenan

Remove render_template and assigns from tests

They are deprecated in rails 5.
Reasoning:  instance variables and which template is rendered in a
controller action are internals of a controller, and controller
tests should not care about them.

params in rails 5.

Auto merge of #1524 - sonalkr132:render_plain, r=segiddins

Use render plain: instead of text:

This is in preparation of rails 5 update. Chips away: https://github.com/rubygems/rubygems.org/pull/1341/commits/e0a5d2ebeff11745180809dda6ec9c7fee046377 ( minus env deprecation).

`render plain: ` was introduced in rails 4.1. https://github.com/rails/rails/pull/14062

Use render plain: instead of text:

`render :text` is deprecated in rails 5.
render :text misdirect people to think that it would render content
with text/plain MIME type. However, render :text actually sets the
response body directly, and inherits the default response MIME type,
which is text/html.

Add test for csrf invalidation when user session expires

Expire session when user signs in or signs out

It fixes following CSRF vulnerability:
* Login with a clearance user account, copy csrf token from any of the forms(for example: edit user form).
* Logout. Go to sign in page, and replace the csrf token in the sign in form with one you copied from your last session.

csrf tokens should be unique per session.

Merge pull request #1459 from sonalkr132/rake_test

Add tests for rake task to update versions file
Set info_checksum in GemInfo instead of rake task

Use only public versions in new version file

It refactores [`versions`](https://github.com/bundler/bundler-api/blob/02c2633278edc81bf2e58bf9d7022b8607fd02e5/lib/bundler_api/gem_info.rb#L69)
implementation using [remove control flag](http://martinfowler.com/bliki/FlagArgument.html)
to avoid [duplication previously needed](https://github.com/rubygems/rubygems.org/pull/1454/files#diff-2cf34b93c3257e00201d866038d19583L76).
Also, note that when we are creating new file, we want to use
`version`'s [`checksum/sha256`](https://github.com/bundler/bundler-api/blob/02c2633278edc81bf2e58bf9d7022b8607fd02e5/lib/bundler_api/gem_info.rb#L86)
for creating `info_checksum`. [`entry[:checksum]`](https://github.com/bundler/bundler-api/blob/02c2633278edc81bf2e58bf9d7022b8607fd02e5/lib/bundler_api/gem_info.rb#L99)
was `nil` when we asked for both indexed and yanked versions.
I haved added patch to match the behavior of bundler-api.
Add tests for rake task to update versions file

Auto merge of #1454 - rubygems:seg-compact-index-versions-file, r=indirect

Ensure that the correct info checksum is used when creating a new versions file

~~This also depends upon https://github.com/bundler/compact_index/pull/20~~

We need to account for the fact that the latest version for a gem could be yanked (or could also not be the lexically last version).
This PR ensures that the new versions file is created with all versions for a gem on the same line, which I believe https://github.com/rubygems/rubygems.org/pull/1453 broke.
It also gets rid of duplicated logic used for fetching the versions, replacing it with logic that de-deuplicates the `CompactIndex::Gem` object and handles yanked versions
Ensure that the correct info checksum is used when creating a new versions file

Introduce GemCachePurger service object

This is now a single resuable object for purging a gem's relevant cache
keys. Purges cache in internal cache (Memcached) and Fastly.

Remove cache on compact index versions response (#1443)

* Remove cache on compact index versions response

Per @indirect, this cache is causing discrepancies between the responses
that are returned by the Bundler API and Rubygems.org's API. Since
Rubygems.org is now behind the Fastly CDN, having this cache is no
longer necessary.

For reference, this cache layer was introduced via 801eb12164ad79a9f112d55d0c3847b115bae4ce.

* Update tests

* Remove `versions` cache instead of `info/*`

Previously commits remove the wrong caching layer. Sorry for the
trouble, the caching code is a little bit confusing :(

Add version navigation links

This is a really basic feature I find myself needing often when looking for
runtime dependency changes in a gem.

![Demo](https://s3.amazonaws.com/f.cl.ly/items/030o0t280F2p3N3T403b/Screen%20Recording%202016-02-19%20at%2012.03%20PM.gif?v=7fc83002)

It adds two simple methods `Version#previous` and `Versions#next` which just use
`self.position - 1` and `self.position + 1`. If adding the links to the UI seems
unnecessary we could even hook up keyboard shortcuts to make this a power-user
feature only but I'll admit I prefer discoverable features.

If this feature makes sense, let me know and I'll add tests. :-)

Fix condition on join and rubocop offences

Using `where` clause after `includes` imposes filter on complete
query, we want filter for scope of dependencies only on the
`join ... on` clause.
We validate scope for inclusion in %w(development runtime), hence
we won't(and don't) have null scope.

remove separate test for ordering

tests to check ordering. We want to make sure that `names` returns gems
in alphabetical order, and that `versions` returns gems in the order
that they were created.

Move info_checksum update to pusher and use md5 checksum on info/:name

version is created when rubygem is saved. However, `required_rubygem_version`, `required_ruby_version` and `dependencies`
are updated from spec after it. check: https://github.com/rubygems/rubygems.org/blob/master/app/models/rubygem.rb#L208
While calculating info_checksum we use those attributes, hence we
should update info_checksum only after those attributes are set.

Use default name for dependency if the original name was unregistered

The problem:
If gemspec sepcified a runtime dependency which was unregistered(ex: typo in gem name), then `gem_info` would blow up for that gem because of
mismatch between the number of requirements and dependency name.

Fix nil info_checksum on versions response and use sql

CompactIndex::GemVersion definition expects checksum/sha256 as third
argument and not info_checkum.
We don't need to display checksum/sha256 because bundler only expects
name, versions and info_checksum. https://github.com/bundler/bundler/blob/master/lib/bundler/vendor/compact_index_client/lib/compact_index_client/cache.rb#L24
```
lines(versions_path).each do |line|
  name, versions_string, info_checksum = line.split(" ", 3)
  ...
end
```

Using raw sql improves response time from 9072-9965ms to 2766-3182ms (min-max over 10 requests).Response time is calculated for version.list file which is 5 months old. Activerecord was eating up a lot of time.

Redirect /api_key/reset to the deprecated action (#1298)

* Redirect `/api_key/reset` to the deprecated action

Why:

* The intented behavior for all API v0 endpoint is to point to
  `api/deprecated#index`, which `/api/reset` was not
* As per #1267, `gems/:id.json` should be `gems/:id`

This change addresses the need by:

* Specifing the `to` option on the `api_key/reset` endpoint, which in necessary
  in only in this particular case because of something rails call
  ["match shorthand"](https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/v4.2.6/actionpack/lib/action_dispatch/routing/mapper.rb#L1513),
  which because of the format of the route (`something/something_else`) will
  override the `to` coming from the scope, assuming we want `something` as the
  controller's name and `something_else` as the action.

Merge pull request #1259 from BobWhitelock/prevent_error_on_stats_page_when_no_downloads

Prevent stats page error when no downloads

Prevent stats page error when no downloads

If the stats page was visited while there were no downloads in the
database, a NoMethodError would be thrown due to
`@most_downloaded.first` being nil. This commit prevents this by
checking it is available before accessing it.

While this issue wouldn't occur in production it could in development
after following the standard instructions for setting up a development
environment in CONTRIBUTING.md.

Use Postgresql to push/pop log files to be processed.

SQS delivers the messages as at-least-one, so we need to make sure our
job is idempotent. Previous implentation was rely on Redis for that, however
there was a TTL on it, which could cause problems if a message is delivered again
after the TTL.

Besides we would like to remove Redis from our stack, for a few other
resons.

Fix N+1 queries on activity api

latest and just_updated endpoints need to load information from a few
other tables, which was causing some big N+1 queries on those endpoints.

inner query, and eliminate the `latest` flag check, as we already check
if thats the only version for that rubygem.

Query dependencies only once.

sides, so there is no need to send 2 queries to the db.
dont stub query on api activities test

Account for translation lazy lookup in test

Since these translations are looked up relative to the views (and the
controller action), we have to harcode their @virtual_path here since
we don't have a controller action to work with.

@virtual_path is used inside ActionView::Helpers::TranslationHelper
to determine the full path to a translation string in the en.yml file.

If there is an exact match when searching, prerender it.

Use the prerender resource hint to speculatively fetch and render a gem's result page when searching and an exact match is found. This should fallback to the prefetch hint (which grabs the document but doesn't render it) when prerender isn't supported.

Merge pull request #1104 from olivierlacan/exclude-yanked-gems-from-reverse-deps

Remove yanked versions from reverse_dependencies

Remove yanked versions from reverse_dependencies

This is something I remember surprising me when reading @schneems'
http://www.schneems.com/blogs/2015-09-30-reverse-rubygems/.

Why did he need to rescue while querying the API for gems depending
on the gem he was searching for?

I got my answer when I tried to run reverse dependencies for rake and
hundreds of exceptions popped up for gems that have been yanked
altogether, not sure why.

Skipping yanked versions will probably speed up this endpoint a bunch
although it's hard for me to test at this point.

I can just log for posterity that before this commit the following requests
total response times were as follows:

- https://rubygems.org/api/v1/gems/rake/reverse_dependencies.json => 4.21 s (X-Runtime: 1.649987)
- https://rubygems.org/api/v1/gems/rails/reverse_dependencies.json => 2.82 s (X-Runtime: 0.522366)
- https://rubygems.org/api/v1/gems/bundler/reverse_dependencies.json => 3.89 s (X-Runtime: 1.636216)
- https://rubygems.org/api/v1/gems/rack/reverse_dependencies.json => 1.97 s (X-Runtime: 0.188214)

Reduce duplication in reverse deps methods

I don't know how I didn't see these were easily chainable in #1099.

This only has a minor impact on the SQL query structure I believe:

Before:

Version.reverse_dependencies("rack").to_sql
=> "SELECT \"versions\".* FROM \"versions\" INNER JOIN \"dependencies\" ON \"dependencies\".\"version_id\" = \"versions\".\"id\" INNER JOIN \"rubygems\" ON \"rubygems\".\"id\" = \"dependencies\".\"rubygem_id\" WHERE \"rubygems\".\"name\" = 'rack'"

Version.reverse_runtime_dependencies("rack").to_sql
=> "SELECT \"versions\".* FROM \"versions\" INNER JOIN \"dependencies\" ON \"dependencies\".\"version_id\" = \"versions\".\"id\" INNER JOIN \"rubygems\" ON \"rubygems\".\"id\" = \"dependencies\".\"rubygem_id\" WHERE \"dependencies\".\"scope\" = 'runtime' AND \"rubygems\".\"name\" = 'rack'"

Version.reverse_development_dependencies("rack").to_sql
=> "SELECT \"versions\".* FROM \"versions\" INNER JOIN \"dependencies\" ON \"dependencies\".\"version_id\" = \"versions\".\"id\" INNER JOIN \"rubygems\" ON \"rubygems\".\"id\" = \"dependencies\".\"rubygem_id\" WHERE \"dependencies\".\"scope\" = 'development' AND \"rubygems\".\"name\" = 'rack'"

After:

Version.reverse_dependencies("rack").to_sql
=> "SELECT \"versions\".* FROM \"versions\" INNER JOIN \"dependencies\" ON \"dependencies\".\"version_id\" = \"versions\".\"id\" INNER JOIN \"rubygems\" ON \"rubygems\".\"id\" = \"dependencies\".\"rubygem_id\" WHERE \"rubygems\".\"name\" = 'rack'"

Version.reverse_runtime_dependencies("rack").to_sql
=> "SELECT \"versions\".* FROM \"versions\" INNER JOIN \"dependencies\" ON \"dependencies\".\"version_id\" = \"versions\".\"id\" INNER JOIN \"rubygems\" ON \"rubygems\".\"id\" = \"dependencies\".\"rubygem_id\" WHERE \"rubygems\".\"name\" = 'rack' AND \"dependencies\".\"scope\" = 'runtime'"

Version.reverse_development_dependencies("rack").to_sql
=> "SELECT \"versions\".* FROM \"versions\" INNER JOIN \"dependencies\" ON \"dependencies\".\"version_id\" = \"versions\".\"id\" INNER JOIN \"rubygems\" ON \"rubygems\".\"id\" = \"dependencies\".\"rubygem_id\" WHERE \"rubygems\".\"name\" = 'rack' AND \"dependencies\".\"scope\" = 'development'"

Merge pull request #1099 from olivierlacan/reverse-runtime-dependencies

Allow fetching only runtime reverse_dependencies from API
Update autoprefixer-rails to version 6.1.0.1

Query only runtime or dev reverse_dependencies

This adds a new query parameter (`only`) to the Reverse Dependencies API endpoint in order to return exclusively gems that declare the provided gem as a runtime or development dependency.

It's often much more important to know which gems use your gem at runtime than all the gems that use your gem in development. In this case
you would pass `?only=runtime`.

If you're only interested in development dependencies, you can use
`?only=development`.

It may make sense to create a whole separate endpoint for this but it seemed simple enough to add a query param for this.

Gaug.es should use async defer, not script injection

Thanks to the browser preloader, using "async" and "defer" attributes will always
be faster in modern browsers. When using script injection, the preloader cannot
start downloading the resource until it evaluates the script (which is currently
at the bottom of the body, after a very large blocking script eval from Typekit).

Move ruby gem not found message in i18n

so we don’t have to repeat

Consistent API error message when a rubygem cannot be found (anymore)

This Pull Request changes the error message of `api/v1/rubygems_controller.rb` to provide a consistent error message for https://rubygems.org users.

Why?

When a gem cannot be found, the current codebase has two kinds of error messages:

- `"This rubygem could not be found"`
- `"This gem does not exist."`

Here are the places use `"This rubygem could not be found"` error message before this Pull Request:

[app/controllers/api/v1/downloads_controller#L21](https://github.com/rubygems/rubygems.org/blob/f55fb1/app/controllers/api/v1/downloads_controller.rb#L21)
[app/controllers/api/v1/versions/downloads_controller.rb#L10](https://github.com/rubygems/rubygems.org/blob/f55fb1/app/controllers/api/v1/versions/downloads_controller.rb#L10)
[app/controllers/api/v1/versions/downloads_controller.rb#L26](https://github.com/rubygems/rubygems.org/blob/f55fb1/app/controllers/api/v1/versions/downloads_controller.rb#L26)
[app/controllers/api/v1/versions_controller.rb#L13](https://github.com/rubygems/rubygems.org/blob/f55fb1/app/controllers/api/v1/versions_controller.rb#L13)
[app/controllers/api/v1/application_controller.rb#L53](https://github.com/rubygems/rubygems.org/blob/f55fb1/app/controllers/application_controller.rb#L53)

And here are the places use `"This gem does not exist."`:

[app/controllers/api/v1/deletions_controller.rb#L30](https://github.com/rubygems/rubygems.org/blob/f55fb1/app/controllers/api/v1/deletions_controller.rb#L30)
[app/controllers/api/v1/rubygems_controller.rb#L23](https://github.com/rubygems/rubygems.org/blob/f55fb1/app/controllers/api/v1/rubygems_controller.rb#L23)

I recently met a bug with this error message: `"This gem does not exist."`.

Here is the case:

This gem [rails-assets-angular](https://rubygems.org/gems/rails-assets-angular) used to host on https://rubygems.org but [yanked](https://github.com/rails-assets/rails-assets/issues/220).

I use [GEM METHODS](http://guides.rubygems.org/rubygems-org-api/#gem-methods) endpoint to get information of this gem. So when I hit this endpoint, the code will first execute [this before action](https://github.com/rubygems/rubygems.org/blob/f55fb1/app/controllers/application_controller.rb#L48-L59) to [find given ruby gem](https://github.com/rubygems/rubygems.org/blob/f55fb1/app/controllers/api/v1/rubygems_controller.rb#L6), and because it used to host on https://rubygems.org, so no problems.

It then executes [Api::V1::RubygemsController#show line 1](https://github.com/rubygems/rubygems.org/blob/f55fb1/app/controllers/api/v1/rubygems_controller.rb#L17) and it failed the check:

```ruby
if @rubygem.hosted? && @rubygem.public_versions.indexed.count.nonzero?
```

Because it no longer hosted on https://rubygems.org. It then renders `"This gem does not exist."`.

I originally play with the API, when it cannot found a gem, it will return `"This rubygem could not be found"`. I was thinking this is the only kind of error message when a rubygem cannot be found.

So I think we should provide a consistent gem not found message.

Upgrade to Clearance 1.10.1

Clearance 1.10 deprecates all clearance-provided password strategies
other than BCrypt. RubyGems is using the `BCryptMigrationToSHA1`
strategy and as such needs to add the
`clearance-deprecated_password_strategies` gem to avoid continue
deprecation messages.

Alternatively, RubyGems could switch to the `BCrypt` strategy and force
anyone not yet migrated to reset their passwords.

Refactor Pusher#load_spec to use Gem::Package

Gem::Package provide a way to load the spec from the .gem file, so the
pusher should use that. On rubygems 2.3+ that method start receiving any
IO and not just a file. As we are on that version, we can use that
method.

This changes one small behaviour though. Now the pusher will only be
able to load_spec for gems that include a data.tar.gz . Gem pushes
without a data will not be accepted anymore.

see https://github.com/rubygems/rubygems/blob/f24c244308266970fdfdee85f5cba8532c936b79/lib/rubygems/package.rb#L663-L666

s/assert_include/assert_includes to be compatible rails 3 and 4

Remove bundler assets group

Rails 4+ dont build an app with assets group anymore, we can remove that right now under rails 3.2 too

Dont use Rails.env before require rails/all

On rails 4.0+ , when calling Rails.env that will be memoized https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/4-0-stable/railties/lib/rails.rb#L56 , so if RAILS_ENV changes after that, for instance for tests https://github.com/rails/rails/commit/3ff263919c67588e4348da30cb92b860fe83cba5 that @_env ivar will have the wrong value.

Solution is not use Rails.env before requiring all rails

Use HTTP_ when setting a header to env

On latest rack versions, you need to setup the headers under env using HTTP_*, this make tests pass under rails 3 and 4
Rename download test to not colide with unit test

Merge pull request #715 from envygeeks/patch-1

Fix the size of Clippy because it prevents Copy.

Fix the size of Clippy because it prevents Copy.

A commit made in #433 / #440 is broken in recent versions of Chrome which do not like Objects to extend past their bounds, the oversizing of the area causes Chrome to trip out (at least on Linux, I assume on Windows and OS X too) because it extends into the text area and thus prevents any manual copy and paste.  This could also be broken by other changes and might not necessarily be related to Chrome at all.

The size of 24px was manually selected after adjusting the maximum size in inspector until I could copy.

Merge pull request #707 from knappe/patch-2

Update versions of rubygem and ruby.

Drop distinction between mysql and mysql2

The `mysql` gem has been deprecated in favor of the `mysql2` gem.  At this point, we shouldn't make a distinction and just point people to the `mysql2` gem.

This also removes a warning about MySQL in Snow Leopard, which included a typo that has been there for about a year.  Given the length of time the typo existed, I would say we're in the clear to remove the entire warning.

Merge pull request #633 from claudiob/patch-2

Keep a consistent sans-serif font

Keep a consistent sans-serif font

This pull request is very font-nerdy :books: but here it goes.

One line of CSS specifies that Arial should be used over Helvetica, when possible. The other line of CSS specifies that Helvetica should be used over Arial, when possible. For visual consistency, the two lines should be the same.

And indeed, there is no need to specify either of those options, since `font-family: sans-serif` [already makes that choice for you](http://css-tricks.com/sans-serif), defaulting to Helvetica on Mac (where it's available) and to Arial on Windows.

Disallow name case changes when there are indexed versions

This makes the lookup case insensitive still, which protects against
multiple users having gems like RAILS or nokogirI. But it fixes an edge
case where the owner might want to change the gem case. We don't allow
changing it when there are indexed versions because doing so screws up
the index matching the filenames of the gems on disk.

Merge pull request #494 from elskwid/local-dev

Local development fixes
Update delayed_job dependency to version 3.0.4

Fix `gemcutter:index:update` rake task

`Pusher#upload` was extracted out into `Indexer`
in a802782c. This updates the index rake task
to use `Indexer.new.perform` instead of the
individual upload steps. Stats get lost but the
upshot is the task works again. Hooray!

Fix server path configuration in development

This fixes path problems when setting up a local
development environment. In dev, Fog uses the 
local storage provider and Indexer assumes all
operations will result in files being written 
to `Pusher.server_path + "/gems"`. With Fog in the
mix, this actually becomes `Pusher.server_path +
s3_bucket + "/gems"`. (`Pusher.server_path` 
defaults to the `server` directory.)

Removing the s3_bucket name from `rubygems.yml`
and the `'gems'` from `Indexer#fog` means that 
gems and index updates are served out of the
`Pusher.server_path` as expected.

No tests for this as the behavior only occurs in
the development environment.

Use the find_gems method defined in the ApplicationController

The find_rubygems method defined in this class does the same thing as
the find_gems method defined in the ApplicationContoller except that it
doesn't have any error handling. This leads to an Internal Server Error
(instead of 404) when a gem/version combination is not found.
For example: https://rubygems.org/gems/rails/versions/0.0.0
